numlitem.para: APU fuel valve is secured closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: If engines cannot be started due to insufficient external power, select UTILITY power OFF. Utility power can be restored after completion of the engine start procedure.

note.para: If utility power is selected off for engine start an EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message may be displayed. It can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If utility power is selected off for engine start a RECIRC FAN UPR or LWR status message may be displayed. Momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each has cleared.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fire switch and warning light on the pilots overhead panel: "APU INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard APU Selector Switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position APU master switch on P5 pilot’s overhead panel to OFF.
Open and collar the following P83 panel circuit breakers: AIR INLET DOOR, APU PRIMARY CONT., and APU START.
Open and collar the P6 main power supply panel circuit breaker APU ALTN CONT.
Access APU fuel valve in left wing gear wheel well, rear wing spar.
Check that override lever on valve actuator indicates CLOSED. If not, manually position override lever to CLOSED position.
